author: Special Correspondent
text:
DMK treasurer M.K. Stalin said the Railway budget was a great disappointment to the people of Tamil Nadu even though there were concessions for senior citizens, women and differently abled persons.

In a statement here, he said it was unfortunate that there was no allocation for projects already announced for Tamil Nadu even though DMK leader wrote a letter to Railway Minister Suresh Prabhu requesting him to resume the projects that were lying idle for lack of fund.

He said there was allocation for the third phase of the Chennai Beach-Korukkupet project. “The AIADMK government that has 37 MPs have failed to prevail upon the Centre to get adequate fund for Tamil Nadu,” he said.
title: Rail budget a disappointment, says Stalin
